diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Combined Turner Syndrome and Langer Mesomelic Dysplasia due to homozygous SHOX deficiency
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The final diagnosis was based on the patient presenting with severe short stature and skeletal deformities, with cytogenetic and genetic analyses confirming the diagnosis of Turner Syndrome and Langer Mesomelic Dysplasia, attributed to a deletion affecting the SHOX gene. GH therapy for 4 years failed to result in growth improvements, indicating the ineffectiveness of GH in this genetic context.
